about.title: About Me
about.description: My name is Francisco González Urriola, but my friends call me Pancho. The first time I programmed was in a robotics workshop using Python, I was 12 years old. Since then I have progressed to be in the third year of the Computer Engineering career at the University of Chile.
about.description1: Part of my progress includes advancing in Software Engineering and Web Application Development to have knowledge and tools to apply my skills in real projects. You can find some of my projects below.

project1.title: DCCPlaces
project1.description: A platform for reserving spaces within the Department of Computer Science, built in a team, using Python with the Django framework

project2.title: AOEdle
project2.description: A trivia game about the video game Age of Empires II, built using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React.js, Node.js)

project3.title: Portfolio
project3.description: The portfolio you're looking at right now, built using Vite, React, and Typescript
